review_text: The condo is everything promised in the description. It was clean, located in a good area and had everything needed for a perfect vacation. I had one major issue that made my rating low. I am travel nurse and rented the entire unit for one month. I never had company and only left the occupancy to go to work and to get something to eat. I allowed another female travel nurse to stay for a little over a week as she transitioned to a new nursing assignment. Corey inquired about the occupant because he voted the cameras and noticed her car there. I explained the situation to him, asked if I needed to provide her information and told her that she would not be there long. He told me that this would be alright. She left for a weekend then came back to finish her last shift at the hospital. After looking in the cameras and seeing her car in the driveway again, he have me an ultimatum to pay an additional $1000+ or vacate the premises in 4 days. He explained that the increase in price was to cover him for liability of she was hurt on the premises or her car was broken into (both of which should be covered by insurance). He also informed me that he was aware of our comings and goings and had dates and time stamps on his camera. I am single woman traveling in a new city so I was very concerned to learn that my every move was being watched. I was also concerned about the increase in price when I clearly paid for the entire unit and not per person. I decided to take him up on his offer and leave early. He reimbursed my money quickly and contacted Airbnb to make sure that everything was resolved appropriately. I heard of people increasing prices for Airbnb for travel nurses but I never experienced this until now. I had to make other preparations to find another place to stay (currently a hotel) which was a huge inconvenience. Most concerning to me was the constant monitoring of the cameras, the unexpected price increase for a guest staying for a week and being asked to leave after I offered to give him the information on the guest when he initially asked for it.

Should we come back to see President Carter again or just for a weekend away from the hustle and bustle of Atlanta, Corey's condo is where we'll be when in Americus!

review_text:
I go to AirBnBs quite regularly as I love to explore in my free time and I also have a job that requires travel very regularly.
Usually, AirBnBs will be set up similarly to hotel rooms - they will have Towels, ToiletPaper, Coffee, AFewMugs, AFewPlates, and a SetOfLinens.
This AirBnb is nothing like that. This place feels like a house that is meant to be lived in. It is fully stocked in every way. Additionally, there were many accessories in this AirBnB that I have never seen in others - like placemats, coasters to set hot pans on, and a hook by the door for keys.
The home is immaculately sealed, as I did not see a single bug or fly or any creature otherwise during my entire stay.
The vibe is more like staying at a family member's home while they are out of town, as opposed to crashing in a motel. Truthfully, it is perhaps the most well thought-out AirBnB I have ever been to. The host is prompt, kind, and very informative. I have no complaints!
